dialogues.text: 3 days. That’s my final offer-- (whispering to Tink) We both need Pan, don’t we Miss Bell. Are you sure you can deliver--

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (whispering back) Does a crock tick in the dark? Hook. "Perish the thought"--then with villainous aplomb.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: After further consideration, in the best interests of all concerned, I have agreed this so-called "Pan" will return in--3_days to commence the war between good-- (thumbing his nose at Peter) and evil--to the death--or--the little rug rats die...like...like...

dialogues.speaker: SMEE
dialogues.text: oeee Fats? Hook frees his claw from the deck to shake on it. A CHEER GOES UP from the Pirates on the deck below.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Guns fire! Pandemonium. SMEE POPS CHAMPAGNE spewing bubbl everywhere. PETER inches his way back up the plank, trying to look grateful. Hook sneers at the other end--

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Go on--whatever you are. Get out of my sight. Fly your carcass out of here-- HOOK JUMPS UP AND DOWN real fast on the plank-- PETER CATAPULTS into the air--suspended for a moment--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I can’t flyyyyy!

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: (to herself, desperate) He...can’t...fly....s PETER--his sad face looking up--a failure--He plummets in the sea and disappears. JACK AND MAGGIE collapse into each other wailing anguish. HOOK makes his way through the celebration, unaware. He waves his hat ascending the stairs to his cabin--

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: (through his frozen smile) I’m.so depressed. Peter Pan... (depressed pause) grew up to be.....a Wuss. He enters his great cabin and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: TINK CIRCLES above Peter’s point of entry, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: TINK
dialogues.text: Swim! Peter! You can swim can’t you? (nothing, just bubbles) I told you you weren’t ready! Didn’t I? Didn’t I say that?...Damn you, Peter Pan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter sinks, struggling to free his hands, kicking, slowl drowning. He blacks out. A BABY CRIES-- startling Peter awake--

dialogues.speaker: LIFE FLASH TO
dialogues.text: EXT. KENSINGTON GARDENS - DAY 1902 - BABY’S POV = DAY MOTHER leans in the "pram" kissing her beautiful new baby boy. She is everything a Mother should be. He coos and giggles the language of babies.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Are you talking to the faeries, my little man? Peter, you are youth-- | you are joy-- | Suddenly everything is dark. THUNDER CRACKS. Rain pours i the pram. Mother is gone. A DARK EVIL FACE leans in. Eyes glowing red. Peter screams--lifted toward the face--

dialogues.speaker: HOOK
dialogues.text: Who and what art thou?

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Screaming! Water choking his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INFANT PETER wails abandoned on a small island in driving rain and thunder. Suddenly the trees are filled with twinkling lights--FAERIES, scores of them, light around Peter holding leaves to shield him from the rain. A YOUNG TINKERBELL slides down his head. A smile. Babytal Tink answers him. He understands. Giggling. Cackling.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: A GIANT FISHTAIL rushes by. HIGH PITCHED squeals echoing! Peter sees something wonderful. He smiles, reaching out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soaring past Big Bend then blurring to a row of houses on Kensington Road--landing outside a garret window. We know this window like the fondest memories of. childhood.
PETER’S POV - THE DARLING NURSERY WENDY age 15, telling a story to a group of stuffed animals. She suddenly senses she’s being watched. She fac the window. She rushes to us--laughing--crying--

dialogues.speaker: . WENDY
dialogues.text: Oh--Peter--I knew you’d come back. I knew you would. I never gave up on you.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: He drowns......DARKNESS CONSUMES US.....

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (VO)
dialogues.text: Peter? If you shut your eyes and you are a lucky one, you may see a shape- less pool of lovely pale colours suspended in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (VO)
dialogues.text: That’s it. If you squeeze your eyes tighter, the colours become so vivid they must go on fire. Just before they do--you see it--See it, Peter? THE COLORS INTENSIFY, BURNING BRIGHT--like the sun on the back of your eyelids--a burst of fiery orange--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A female silhouette blocks the glare.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (VO)
dialogues.text: Wake up, Peter. You must.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON PETER
dialogues.text: No signs of life. Skin blue and pale. He doesn’t blink. H lips icy. Webbed feminine hands lower a Nautilus shell ov his mouth and nose. TURQUOISE LIPS blow gently into it. H chest heaves--He coughs up water--gasping for air!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Mother? PETER’S POV - THE VIVID COLORS TAKE SHAPE - ANGELIKA, the face of an angel, UNA, a husky temptress, BABS, turquoise lips and flaming orange hair, fawn over him. Their laughter is like tinkling glass.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Am I...dead?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELIKA
dialogues.text: Only if you want to be. He’s sprawled on a rock, his legs dangling in turquoise waters, clothes tattered and torn. He sees the Maidens fr the waist up. It’s an ample view. Angelika and Una caress him with langorous strokes. He’s embarassed and aroused.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELIKA
dialogues.text: You’re safe here, Peter. Forever...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You know who I am? The 3 MAIDENS laugh seductively. Nodding in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELIKA
dialogues.text: Oh, don’t be silly. Everybody knows Peter Pan.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: -.-I really am...Peter Pan....

dialogues.speaker: BABS
dialogues.text: Of course you are. We should know.

dialogues.speaker: UNA
dialogues.text: We saw what happened. We saved you. Hook’s so disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELIKA
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you fly away?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: i gan‘t fly.

dialogues.speaker: UNA
dialogues.text: Yes you can.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: No....I don’t remember how. BABS . Well, why didn’t you fight then?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I can’t fight. Look at me. I’m...old--

dialogues.speaker: ANGELIKA
dialogues.text: You’re only old if you want to be.

dialogues.speaker: BABS.
dialogues.text: You’re strong. Look at those muscles. She strokes his muscleless arms. Peter flushes. Unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I--do work out...but I’m not the same person I used to be. : Babs grabs his "love handles" on both his hips--

dialogues.speaker: BABS
dialogues.text: Ohhhh--You’re perfect.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELIKA
dialogues.text: See for yourself. The waters do not lie. She smoothes a water surface to the stillness of glass.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELIKA
dialogues.text: The lagoon reflects what’s inside of you. What’s inside of everyone.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WATER
dialogues.text: Staring back at Peter is a BOY--age 12 or 13. Peter at th age. Mischief in his eyes. Hair wild. Body lean--muscular He touches his face. The reflection does too. Peter slowl grins--so does his image. He is awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELIKA
dialogues.text: The child is there, Peter. You just have to find it. Angelika’s form blurs past him KERPLOPADA! Right in the center of the reflection. She has a tail! Babs and Una follow--their sleek fish-tailed forms knife into the wate He hurries along the rock jetty in pursuit. The 3 Mermaid cruise beside him, splashing, laughing, flirting, displaying their incredible forms.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Wait? How do I find it?

dialogues.speaker: UNA
dialogues.text: (blatant solicitation) I’d love to show you, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: BABS
dialogues.text: (flaunting her assets) It’s my turn to show him. Let me.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELIKA
dialogues.text: The choice is Peter’s. He’s a big boy. They ogle him like a hunk at the beach. Peter, embarassed stops suddenly at the end of the rock. Under double rainbows, the magnificent lagoon spreads before hin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavorting with Dolphins, leaping in review for him. Sunni their incredible forms on the rocks raising up to see Pan Near the waterfall, Mermaids play a kind: of basketball w brightly colored bubbles and giant clamshell goals at eac end visible in the spray. (right out of Barrie} All call his name and wave---

dialogues.speaker: MERMAIDS
dialogues.text: Hi, Peter! It’s Peter! He’s back! <+-chanting in high pitched dolphin-like voices. A CACAPHONY of the most wonderful feminine sounds--

dialogues.speaker: UNA
dialogues.text: Come on in, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: BABS
dialogues.text: Jump! Jump, Peter!

dialogues.speaker: ANGELIKA
dialogues.text: c’mon, Peter! We’re waiting for you! Peter looks around like a 12 year old kid to see if his parents are watching. He finds us--

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (naughty devilish grin) I think...I’/m having a happy thought. No kidding? HE LEAPS---YELLING all the way down--a perfec CANNONBALL into the school of adoring Mermaids. cUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lost Boy camp sits on a bluff. A tangle of haphazard treehouses, rope ladders and underground hideouts. A 2 masted Sloop that has seen better days rests on launc blocks at the edge of the water. Haphazard repairs and renovations evident. A nameplate; "THE DARK AVENGER".
